page.title: 02BATESWOOD OPEN CAST MINE
page.content: The open cast mine near our school takes up a large area of land.It has been here for about 6 years and will be mined for about another 4 years.It employs about 60 men working from 7am in the morning to 7pm at night.Often the men work overtime. The mine is allowed to bore down to 75 metres and we have had permission to visit the site to see the work. Years ago the land was all grassland and trees with a footpath across it to Scot Hay.Today the trees and grass and wildlife have gone and we cannot walk along the path because huge Caterpillar trucks are moving the soil,rocks and coal.When I went they showed me the machinery and trucks - one of them could hold 50 tonnes of rocks or coal. John Beckett.
